summary: The Second Congo War (1998-2003) was a major conflict in Africa, also known as Africa's World War. It started when Congo's president, Laurent-Désiré Kabila, turned against his former allies, Rwanda and Uganda. The war spread across Africa, involving 9 countries and many armed groups. It ended with a peace agreement in 2003, but violence continued in some areas. The war caused an estimated 5.4 million deaths, making it the world's deadliest conflict since World War II, mostly due to disease and malnutrition.
title: Second Congo War
